physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features several lions
 behind a metal cage door. One lion is resting her head on the door
 looking out towards the camera. There are several other lions in the cage behind her. The cage door looks rusty. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
subject_terms_1:Panthera leo (species) cages (enclosures) snapshots

subject_terms_3:Photography
subject_terms_4:
sgcool_label_text:This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of lions behind a cage
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features several lions, behind a metal cage door. One lion is resting her head on the door, looking out towards the camera. There are several other lions in the cage behind her. The cage door looks rusty. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
